summary: This is a confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 30, 2019, requesting that inmate Jeffrey Epstein be provided with an electrical extension cord to power his CPAP machine during the evening.

persons.name: M.D.
persons.context: Author of the memorandum requesting an extension cord for Jeffrey Epstein's CPAP machine.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate (designated #76318-054) for whom an electrical extension cord is requested to power his CPAP machine.

connections.description: M.D., as Acting Clinical Director, is making a medical accommodation request for inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: CPAP Cord Request for Epstein
events.description: A memorandum is issued requesting an electrical extension cord be provided to inmate Jeffrey Epstein for his CPAP machine.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
It is dated July 30, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest but before his death.
The memo requests an electrical extension cord for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (ID #76318-054) to use with his CPAP machine during the evening.
The request is made by 'M.D.', the Acting Clinical Director, indicating a medical accommodation.
The document is part of the official record, labeled CONFIDENTIAL and bearing identifiers SDNY_00011634 and EFTA00139703.
